Volume 3 Chapter 20 Before the Battle
"That old guy actually refused?! He was so brave when he attacked my father, but now he is afraid! Your leader is a coward! A coward! He doesn't deserve to live in the stronghold of Tusim! If he still has a bit of shame, go back to where he came from! Don't defile this land!" Dorisa neurotically vented his accumulated anger.

The messenger glared at him fiercely, but held back and said nothing.

"Oh, that old man is very cautious!" Hiro said lightly. In this era, battles often occurred between Greek city-states. When the defending party hid in the city because of weakness and refused to fight, the simple siege conditions made the attacking party only destroy the houses and farmland outside the city and force the opponent to come out for a fight. The Lukelam people were a half-farming and half-pastoral tribe, and there was no house outside the mountain stronghold. Hiro could not force the opponent to come out for a fight in this way, but he had a better and bloodier method.

"Anchialo, bring a wounded man here!" Not long after he finished speaking, two Thracian axemen came over with a naked man.

"Servi!" The messenger recognized him at a glance with surprise.

The Lukelam man, who had been hungry all night and had lost too much blood due to his injuries, raised his head with difficulty. At this moment, the sharp axe blade slashed across his neck, and the headless body fell to the ground, blood gushing out from the neck, but the head rolled to Dorisa's feet, scaring him so much that he screamed and jumped in panic.

Hiro suppressed the nausea in his heart and said coldly to the terrified and angry messenger: "Go back and tell your leader that if he doesn't come out to fight, I will kill all these captives one by one and then leave here!"

When Rousseau saw the Greeks swinging axes and killing people in the sentry post, he knew what his biggest concern was: the Greeks were actually forcing him to fight by killing prisoners!

The Bruttii had only fought wars with two kinds of people before: one was with their own people, the Mepeans, and the Lucanians, who were basically branches of the Samnites; the other was with the Greeks in Italy. The former had never slaughtered prisoners because of their blood relationship. The latter had always attacked Greek cities, and the Greeks rarely besieged their villages. Besides, the Greeks always advocated frontal battles and the honor of warriors, so there had never been such a situation. Perhaps only the Persians had done such a thing.

Therefore, Rousseau did not expect that the Greeks would use such a vicious method to force him to fight. He listened to the messenger's reply with a solemn face. One of the elders burst into tears: "Servi, my son!..."

Everyone present was moved.

"Great chief, facing such evil behavior of the enemy, we can't remain silent any longer! Can you watch Talperi and Fabric die tragically in front of you? !! Do you want to see us rob these relatives again after losing five hundred of our people? !! Even if I fail or even die, I, Flamini, will not be a cowardly sheep!!!" Flamini shouted angrily. This may be the most courageous sentence he has ever said in his life.

Almost everyone was incited by him and their blood boiled.

Roulsuo sighed: Eighty-nine tribesmen, all of them are blood relatives, their parents and relatives are almost everyone in the village, how can he watch them die, not to mention that his two sons are among them!

Just when he made up his mind, Fei Qiya said loudly: "Great Chief! Since they want to fight, then give them the war! I think we can definitely win this battle!"

Lurso's spirits lifted, and other elders gathered around him. At this moment, they temporarily put aside their internal struggle.

"I heard from the fleeing soldiers that the Greeks' powerful axemen are their battle axemen, because they use two hands to wield axes and are not equipped with shields. Our short spears can completely penetrate their leather armor, and there are not many of them."

Feiqiya's words made everyone's eyes light up. He then continued, "I know Tusim. Among their elders, Dikwei is just like me. He has been suppressed by the previous leader for a long time and has always wanted to leave Tusim. Perhaps because of our failure last time, he leaned towards Dorisa again. But in the battle, he will definitely not use his full strength. As long as we give Tusim a heavy blow at the beginning of the battle, he will hesitate and may even surrender in front of the battle!..."

"Feqiya, I was right about you!" Rousso was overjoyed and gave an order: "I decided to let you lead the army to deal with the Tusim people, and I will stop the Greeks!"

…

When Shiloh and his companions learned that the Lukelam people agreed to a battle, they also gathered together to discuss it.

Before the war, Dorisa did not show off his strength. He gave the power to arrange the battle formation to Shiloh, who took on this important task without hesitation. He deployed his troops on the left wing. Shiloh was given to Dorisa, who was the most trustworthy and had the most troops, as the middle road connecting his left wing. The front row of the right wing was Dikwe, and the back row was Balbra.

Before Dickway could object, Balbra shouted, "Why put me at the back? My people are much braver than Dickway!"

"Because I don't need you to attack at the beginning, you just need to hold the line. In this regard, Dickway is more stable than you." Shiloh's face was full of confidence: "Please believe me, the enemy's right wing will collapse soon, and that's when you, Balbra, can show your ability!"

Balbula wanted to say something, but Dorisa interrupted, "Today's battle with Lukeram is related to the survival of our Tusim. If we win, Tusim will become stronger, but if we lose, our tribe will perish! So we must strictly abide by the combat orders. If any of our tribe members dare to escape privately, I will kill him after the victory and sacrifice him to the mountain god Nim!" Dorisa's murderous eyes swept over everyone, and finally fell on Dickwei, and then became gentle: "Dickwei, I have had some minor conflicts with you in the past. I hope that in this battle, you will work together with me to defeat the Lukeram people! Here I swear to the mountain god Nim that I will treat your people as I treat my people in the future, and I will never be biased!"

Dikwi also excitedly expressed his opinion immediately: "Chief, my people will use their bravery to prove their loyalty to Tusim to the God of Nim Mountain!" After Dikwi said these words, he glanced at Shiloh next to him: he didn't think that the arrogant Dorisa would take the initiative to show his goodwill to him. It must be the suggestion that this Greek made to Dorisa when he discussed the attack with Dorisa yesterday afternoon. What Dikwi really cares about is what this Greek said, "It can quickly defeat the right wing of the Lukelam people"!

Shiloh returned to his own phalanx. The soldiers who were sitting on the ground to rest wanted to stand up, but he stopped them.

He paced in front of the square, and in the spotlight of everyone, he walked up to Misconon and said, "Even if everyone else gets up, you will continue to lie down!"

Someone in the square laughed.

Misko sat up lazily and said, "Anyway, the battle hasn't started yet, let me rest for a while and recover my strength!"

Shiloh smiled, took a few more steps forward, and then stopped. "Dimis, this is your first time fighting as a heavy infantryman. Are you going to be uncomfortable? Be careful not to let the iron shield fall and hurt your feet!"

There was a burst of laughter in the square.

Demis blushed, "We sailors must also be excellent heavy infantrymen!"

Xi Luo smiled and said with concern: "Don't be too aggressive, take care of yourself, and don't let your mother and sister worry!"

Demis nodded in astonishment.

Shiloh continued to move forward. When he stood in front of Tachiadi, Tachiadi quickly stood up. Shiloh said, "For this battle, I will still place your team in the first row. Do you think this will not be fair?"

Tachiadi pounded his hand on his left chest and said firmly: "Master, this is the glory of our team!"

Xi Luo nodded with satisfaction and said, "Command your team well! I believe you will be an excellent officer in the future!"

While Tachiadi was extremely excited, Hiro's gaze turned to the side: "Agatok, you won't violate military orders again this time, right?" Agatok stood up hurriedly, too ashamed to speak, and Hiro patted him on the shoulder to comfort him.

He finally walked to the end of the phalanx, and Anchialo held a huge axe in his hand, staring at him.

"I will fight with you this time. Be careful when you swing your axe, don't hit me!" Anchialou replied in a muffled voice: "Well... I can't control that..."

Everyone laughed. Shiloh walked to the center of the square while laughing. When the laughter died down, he said in a high-pitched voice: "Warriors! Yesterday we defeated an enemy four times our size in the Adrosene River, proving how powerful we are! Today, we will defeat the Lukelam people once again with the weapons in our hands, and win all the land on the south bank of the Adrosene River for ourselves! On that land, we will build a city-state! A city-state that belongs to us!"

"To the original Athenians who are about to become citizens of the city-state, and to the slaves who will become citizens of the city-state in the next few years! Today will be a day worth remembering for all of us! Decades later, when you talk about this day to your descendants, you can proudly tell them that it was you who used your bravery and blood to establish a powerful city-state!"

"I swear! Whether you are a freeman or a slave, your names will be engraved on the city-state's monument, forever for future generations to admire! I swear, if we win, my slaves will be rewarded for two years of hard work again! I swear, the freemen will get more land! My warriors, in order for this day to come soon, we must unite as a whole like last time, remember military orders, face the enemy, and move forward bravely!" Chapter 99:
Volume 3 Chapter 21 Battle of Lukelum
"victory!"

"victory!!"

"victory!!!"

The soldiers, whose blood boiled at these words, were like surging waves, one wave higher than the other, shocking the Tusim people nearby.

"Is this why the Greeks are so powerful?!" Dorisa was inspired and said to his people, "You all see, as the masters of this land, we Tusim people cannot lose to these Greeks!"

…

When the sun was slightly west in the sky, the two sides set up the battlefield on the flat ground in front of the mountain stronghold. On Lukelum's side: Rurso was on the right wing, Feiqia was in the middle, and other elders such as Flamini were on the left wing, totaling more than 900 people. On Tusim's side: Shilo was on the left wing, Dorisa was in the middle, Balbra and Dikwe were on the right wing, totaling about 700 people.

The two sides were about 200 meters apart.

This was the first time that Hilo participated in a regular battle. All the deployments were carried out under the enemy's eyes, and there was no secret at all. His troops were not many, but he still extended his phalanx outward, with a depth of only 10 rows. Here he secretly played a little trick: he took Secito, Herim, Picos and ten other elite heavy infantrymen to the outermost first row, and hid Anchialo and his battle axemen in the second row, so that the enemy could not find their specific location.

Rousso was surprised that the Greeks had such a thin phalanx, but he was cautious and stretched his own phalanx to prevent the enemy from surrounding his flanks. And the elders of Lukelum, such as Flamini, relied on their large numbers to stretch the formation. In contrast, Dikvi and Balbula did not make corresponding changes.

Everything was set up, and Dorisa couldn't wait to have the trumpeter blow the horn.

“Woo! …Woo!”

“Woo! …Woo!”

Lukelam also sounded the horn, and both sides' arrays, each three hundred meters long, began to advance slowly.

As the Brutti walked, they struck their wooden shields with their short spears and shouted "Oh! Oh...", looking very powerful.

Only the Greek phalanx advanced silently, the breastplates and iron shields made a low sound due to collision, and the rows of spears standing above shone coldly under the sunlight, making the Lukelam people on the opposite side feel more pressured.

When both sides walked a hundred meters apart, they took out their spears.

After seeing the faces of the enemies, the team in the middle lane of Dorisa suddenly quickened their pace. Because they were facing the people of Feiqia. It was their betrayal that caused Tusim to lose so many brothers! It was the betrayer who forced them to leave the village where they had lived since childhood! Now it was time for revenge!

The advance in the center also boosted the pace of the right wing. Only the Greek phalanx on the left wing was still advancing slowly at the original rhythm.

When the Tusim people rushed to fifty meters, they threw their spears with all their might, and the Lukelam people also threw their spears at this time.

For a moment, countless short spears filled the air, blocking the scorching sun, as if it had suddenly become night. In the blink of an eye, short spears fell like hail, and countless screams immediately rang out on both sides...

The second round of throwing was much weaker. Some of the Brutti hurriedly threw two short spears and began to move forward, while others were preparing to throw the second one. The formations of both sides were in disarray at this time.

As both sides continued to advance, countless corpses and wounded were left on the grass behind them, and their groans were just the prelude to the battle.

The troops of Rousso drew their short spears and waited for the Greeks to come within range. The Greeks did not have short spears that would allow them to throw their weapons easily.

However, the Greek phalanx stopped at a distance of sixty meters. In the eyes of the Lucelamites, the phalanx split into more than a dozen passages, and dozens of naked captives were driven in front of the phalanx.

Oh no, the Greeks want to use our people as shields! Rousso immediately came to his senses, but the Greeks had already started to drive the captives away. They directly stabbed the captives in the back with their spears. The captives were already weak and depressed due to hunger, but the pain stimulated their desire to survive. They shouted in panic and ran desperately towards their people not far away. In their fragile hearts, it seemed that the other side was the safest fortress.

The Greeks followed them and rushed towards Rousseau's team.

The matter was hasty, and Luerso had no idea what to do at this moment. Not only him, but the entire Lukeram people on the right wing were stunned, because the people running towards them were their own people who had suffered so much. Hearing their shrill cries, every Lukeram person felt very sad, and they did not throw their short spears. In that instant, they seemed to have forgotten the enemy with ferocious fangs bared behind the captives. They did not take any measures to stop these people from charging into their army formation, but were hugged by these almost crazy people, shouting for help.

When the captives used their bodies to block the spears of their fellow warriors, the sharp spears of the Greeks immediately stabbed in. The soldiers strictly followed Hero's instructions and did not stab the captives with their spears, but stabbed the enemies whose hands and feet were trapped by the captives through the gaps.

The Lukelam warriors never imagined that they had fought a battle to save their people, but they never thought that they would be killed by the very people they wanted to save. This was truly the saddest thing!

The axemen behind Shiloh quickly surrounded the Lukelam from the outside, and the phalanx, which originally had only two rows, was reduced to only one row formed by Shiloh and others at the head. If the enemy relied on a thick formation and fiercely attacked, then even if Shiloh, Picos and other elite heavy infantry were brave, they would definitely be broken through the front, and the axemen who rushed from the flank would be cut off and trapped.

However, the "outstanding performance" of the captives caused the bloody scene on the banks of the Adrothene River to reappear. The heavy infantry led by Shiloh were extremely skilled and fast in accurately stabbing the chests of the enemies behind the captives with their spears.

…

The fight in the middle was even more brutal. In order to deal a heavy blow to Dorissa quickly, Feiqia put his most courageous warriors in the front row, but the Tusims, especially the warriors of the Dorissa clan, hated the enemy's betrayal and were willing to stab the enemy to the ground even if they were injured. Originally, the fight in the middle was the most persistent, because there were no flanks to use, and both sides were in dense formations, and the warriors were protected by shields, so the casualty rate was not high compared to the two wings. However, at this moment, from the moment of contact in the middle, pairs of people from both sides fell from time to time, and the death rate was alarmingly high. This situation was beyond Feiqia's expectations, and he underestimated the Tusim's fighting spirit.

He felt this change in the formation. According to his original idea, the bravery of the first row of soldiers would surely force Dorisa's team to retreat. Now the team is advancing, but that is because the second row of soldiers has begun to contact the enemy. Fei Qiya, who is in the rear, is anxious, but there is nothing he can do. At this moment, the battle has begun. He can no longer control his team. He can only inspire the fighting spirit of the soldiers around him by shouting constantly.

…

Compared to the stalemate in the middle, the pressure on the right wing of Tusim was much greater. When the front team of Dikwei came into contact with the enemy, they followed the pre-match deployment and did not rush forward, but instead fought steadily with the enemy. However, the extended left wing of the Lukelam people naturally came around from the outside, and Balbula, as the rear team, immediately led his people to meet them and blocked the enemy's attack on the flank.

Fortunately, Dikvi and Balbra were always accustomed to fighting with their own people. Otherwise, suddenly dividing the entire right wing into two parts would undoubtedly cause short-term chaos in the formation of the Brutti people who lacked military training, giving the enemy an opportunity to take advantage.

Before the battle, after seeing the enemy's formation, the Tusim people prepared such a change of formation, but they were not professional warriors and had not undergone long-term drills. Therefore, the connection between the Dikwe and Balbula teams was not tight, allowing the Lukelam people to rush into the gap and attack the Tusim flanks on both sides. Once they were allowed to expand the gap, that would be the time for the Tusim right wing to collapse.

When Dikwi was marching in the phalanx, he saw that the focus of the attack of the Lukelamites was on his right wing, and the reason why he did not choose to retreat was because of what Hero said. Although he himself could not explain why he placed the life and death of his entire tribe on a young Greek, he was determined to persist until he could no longer hold on.

…

Because Rousso followed the Greek phalanx and stretched his own formation, its depth was not very thick. The attack of the Thracian axemen and the Helot heavy infantry led to the rapid annihilation of the tail end of Rousso's right wing.

When the two teams met, Xiluo didn't even bother to wipe the blood off his face and shouted, "Warriors, follow me and kill them!"

He charged forward with his spear raised, and Secito and Hrim closely guarded him. Anchialo, Picos, Timathus and more than 20 others attacked the rear of the right wing of the Lukelamites from left to right. Although these 20 people were only a drop in the bucket compared to the total number of soldiers involved in the battle, they were the only mobile force on the Tusim side. They were like a small pebble in the snow, which would only get bigger as it rolled downwards, thus completely smashing the enemy's huge phalanx.

When the captives saw their tribesmen dying tragically, their already fragile nerves became extremely frightened. They desperately squeezed forward to reach the safety of the rear, and they even pushed down the tribesmen who stood in front of them. The entire right wing of the Lukelam people fell into chaos.

When these captives rushed towards Rousso's team, they did not have the heart to throw their spears in time, which doomed them to defeat!

Rousso was in the middle of the battle, and the constant screams and curses from the surroundings made him extremely anxious, but he had no way to restore order to the chaotic team. Until a prisoner rushed in front and knocked him down. Volume 3 Chapter 22 Poseidon
The moment he fell to the ground, Rousso recognized who the prisoner was from his extremely distorted face.

"Tarpeia!" he shouted excitedly and sadly, but got no response.

The guards hurriedly tried to help him up, and at this moment, the extremely low morale of Lukeram's right wing completely collapsed.

They desperately fled like stray dogs, with countless feet stepping on Lurso. The old man who once created the glory of Lukeram died in infinite sadness under the feet of his own people...

"Don't chase! Attack to the right!"

In the chaotic left-wing battlefield where flags and horns could not be used, a unified voice was undoubtedly the best means of communication. It made the slave soldiers who were blindly chasing the defeated soldiers stop and return to the attacking camp.

Just as they were about to approach the enemy troops in the center, Hilo ordered the entire army to stop advancing.

Under the surprised gaze of Picos and the others, he began to reorganize the formation. Reorganizing the formation in the battle was undoubtedly a way to death, but fortunately, at this moment, there were only fleeing soldiers on the left wing.

Shiloh did this for two reasons: first, to make the attack more efficient and prevent accidental injuries. You know, a swarm attack often makes it impossible to deploy troops, causing a blockage in the attack. Second, he didn't mind letting Tusim die a few more people, so that they can get along better in the future...

When both sides in the center were exhausted from fighting, the Greek phalanx completely stuck to the rear team of the Kelamites in the center and completely surrounded Dikwe's team.

Destruction happens in just a moment.

Fei Qiya led his personal soldiers and broke out of the siege.

After Shiloh and Dorisa resolved the battle in the middle, they turned their attention to the left wing.

On the left wing, the Lukelams had opened a gap, separating Dikwe from Balbra's troops. Their flanks began to bear the blow, and it was only a matter of time before they collapsed.

Here, the news came that Lukelum's right wing and center had been defeated, and fear quickly devoured their courage like locusts. Before the troops of Shiloh and Dorisa had completely surrounded them, they had already collapsed.

Dickwei breathed a sigh of relief. His choice this time was finally the right one!

The only thought in the defeated soldiers' minds was to escape back to the mountain stronghold!

But when they escaped from the enemy's pursuit and ran to the front of the mountain stronghold, they found that the entrance to the mountain stronghold was blocked by dozens of spearmen. They were the reserve troops formed by Shiloh's workshop slaves. Shiloh did not send them to the battlefield, but after the war, he let them quietly block the only entrance to the mountain stronghold.

This narrow path was the basis for the Lukelam people to defend their stronghold, but now it became the key to their life and death. The panicked fleeing soldiers did not have the courage to break through the blockade of the spears until more and more people gathered and the elders arrived, and then they decided to attack the spearmen.

But at this moment, Tusim and the Greeks also arrived and surrounded them in front of the stronghold.

When the Lukelam people learned from the guards of Rurso that their old leader might have been killed in the chaos, the last psychological support collapsed. Led by the elders, they collectively surrendered to Tusim.

The Brutti believed in the "law of the jungle", where the strong were respected and the victor could annex the clan of the defeated. This was how Tusim developed.

In this battle, Dorisa's team suffered nearly 100 casualties, Dikwe and Balbra's teams suffered dozens of casualties, and the casualties of Shiloh's team were negligible. The Lukelam people suffered 400 casualties, most of which were caused by trampling on each other during the rout.

The Tusim coalition defeated the Lukelam with a smaller force and annexed its clan.

Lukeram's hegemony lasted only a few months before it was wiped out...

…

On this day, the sky was high and the clouds were light, and the wind was fresh and the air was refreshing.

On the banks of the Adrosene River, the Greeks, their families, children and slaves gathered together to discuss the construction of the city.

Picos and his people once questioned Hero, asking: "Why should such a major event as the establishment of a city-state be allowed to involve those lowly slaves?"

Xi Luo said slowly: "If the number of enemies you kill exceeds those slaves, I can ask them not to participate!"

The Greeks were speechless when they remembered the efforts and sacrifices made by the slaves to help them gain a foothold here.

Now, everyone was equally excited. They looked at the young man who was walking slowly towards the center with awe. It was he who led them out of the predicament of being expelled from Athens and came to this fertile land! It was he who led them to create miracles, defeated powerful enemies twice, and owned this fertile land!

He stood in the center, his sturdy and strong body was full of strength, his deep eyes were full of wisdom, the warm sunshine fell on him, and his golden curly hair emitted a dazzling light, like a god!

Everyone held their breath, only hearing the flowing river, the singing birds, and the majestic voice of Hero echoing in their hearts: "Unyielding Greeks! Brave slaves! Today is a day that will be remembered forever for each of us! Perhaps it is a day that the gods should be jealous of! We will have our own city! A city that truly belongs to each of us! Although it is still very weak and simple now, we will grow with it until one day, its name will resound throughout Italy! Resound throughout Greece! Resound throughout the Mediterranean! When those people know that we are from here, they will envy us for our wealth and be impressed by our strength! Let us work together for the early arrival of that day! ”

The crowd was excited by the bright prospects described by Shiloh. They waved their arms and cheered loudly.

The next step is to name the city-state.

At once, everyone spoke enthusiastically, and even the slaves expressed their opinions: the slaves from Egypt were given an Egyptian-style name, and the slaves from Macedonia were given a Macedonian-style name...

In the end, the focus of the debate was on two names: one was "New Athens" proposed by Flaccus and Picos, on the grounds that they were from Athens and established a city-state in Italy, which was equivalent to a colony of Athens. Moreover, the meaning of "New Athens" was "a brand new Athens", which meant that the new city-state would be as prosperous and powerful as Athens in the future! This name was supported by most of the heavy infantry. The other was "Poseidia", which was proposed by sailors such as Nurnus and Callikretus, meaning "the land of the sea god". They believed that they could come here today because of the blessing of Poseidon, the god of the sea. From escaping from the storm when escaping from Sicily, to Helo winning the championship at the Isthmus, to dolphins leading the way when coming to Italy... These were all arrangements from Poseidon, the god of the sea, so of course the city had to be named after him.

The two sides argued with each other, but could not agree. In ancient times, Poseidon and Athena had a dispute over Athens. Unexpectedly, a similar scene was repeated in this new city-state that was about to be born. But this time, the gods would not come to the world to please the people. But people all looked to Hero, the "patron of the gods" standing in the center, and gave him the final decision.

Shiloh made a prompt decision to hold a referendum to decide the final name, including the slaves.

This measure was strongly opposed by Flaccus, who shouted: "How can such a sacred matter as naming a city be desecrated by a group of lowly slaves!"

Hiro looked at him coldly. Flaccuston felt cold all over. He sat down involuntarily. Hiro raised his arms and shouted: "Without the slaves' hard work, how could the city-state be established today! When you were dividing the fertile land, have you ever thought that they were crying for their dead companions! People who drink water should not forget the hard work of the well diggers, and people who eat pomegranates should not forget the kindness of the pomegranate planters! I think our city-state should establish a law that no one can insult slaves and call them "lowly"! Whoever violates it must be whipped!"

When these words were spoken, the heavy infantry were dismayed, the sailors didn't care, and the slaves cheered.

"Shiloh! The formulation of laws should be decided by the council after the establishment of the city-state!" At this time, Picos stood up and said with gritted teeth.

Shiloh didn't continue to dwell on this small issue. He just made a gesture. He didn't pick up Picos's words and said, "The referendum begins!"

The vote was simple. Those who supported "New Athens" voted for a piece of grass, and those who supported "Poseidon" voted for a stone. The final result was as Flaccus expected. "Poseidon" was chosen with a high vote. Among them, more than 100 slaves who had been sailors and were now soldiers played an important role. After all, after years of fighting on the rough sea, they could only entrust their lives to Poseidon, the god of the sea.

Flaccus sat there with a livid face.

Hiro smiled in his heart and said loudly: "You all chose the name 'Poseidia', which shows that you have great ambitions. You do not want to be the second Athens, but want to build a unique city-state that is far superior to Athens! From today on, our city-state will be called 'Poseidia'! And we are the Poseidians!"

"Oh, Poseidon?"

"Poseidon!!"

Everyone cheered with joy, especially the slaves, because they felt particularly honored that they had contributed to the name.

After the name of the city-state was determined, the symbol of the city-state was also quickly determined: the dolphin and the trident.

It was already noon, and Shiloh asked Alesha to lead the female slaves to distribute bread to everyone, and continue the discussion after dinner.

At this time, Picos had already felt something was wrong, so he took Misconon to find Nurnussis. Picos got straight to the point and whispered, "Nurnussis, when we discuss how to govern the city-state, I hope you and your people will stick with us to implement the Athenian democracy in Bosaiah. I'm worried that Hero wants to be a tyrant!" (To be continued. Political System Struggle
Nurnusis and Callikretu looked at each other, and Nurnusis shook his head and said, "Picos, it seems that you have not yet seen the current situation clearly!" He pointed at the slaves opposite and said, "After defeating Lukelum and forming an alliance with Tusim, Shiloh has established a firm foothold here. Moreover, after two battles, his slaves have become qualified soldiers. In fact, we are now dispensable!"

"What do you mean? Is Shiloh going to break the agreement we made with us?!" Misconon was shocked.

"Miskonon!" Kallikretu explained, "Nurnusis means that we are no longer an important political force and are not strong enough to force Shiloh to negotiate!"

"Hmm!" Nurnusis shook the bread in his hand and said, "Besides, we still rely on Shiloh for food. It doesn't seem good to eat what he gives us while opposing him!"
